title: 'He's in the top five players in the world': Ferdinand labels Sterling the best player in England
text:
Rio Ferdinand described Raheem Sterling as one of the best 'five players in the world' following his devastating display against Atalanta in the Champions League.

Sterling lit-up the Etihad Stadium with an 11-minute second-half hat-trick as City trounced their Serie A opponents 5-1 on Tuesday night - the forward also assisted both of Sergio Aguero's first-half strikes.

After the game, former United defender Ferdinand couldn't speak highly enough of Sterling's development under Pep Guardiola, insisting he is the best player in the Premier League right now.

MANCHESTER CITY PLAYERS NOMINATED FOR THE BALLON D'OR Raheem Sterling Sergio Aguero Bernardo Silva Riyad Mahrez Kevin De Bruyne

‘He’s in the top five players in the world now, definitely,' Ferdinand told BT Sport.

‘I don’t care who you want to mention, the five top players – he’s got to be in that conversation.

‘Because the amount of goals he’s getting, the effect he’s having on games. It’s impossible to keep him out.'

Asked whether he was the best player in the Premier League, Ferdinand responded: ‘I’d say yeah. I love everything about him.’

Sterling was named on the 30-man shortlist for the Ballon d'Or on Monday - Lionel Messi, Cristiano Ronaldo and Virgil Van Dijk are favourites for the award, considered the unofficial gong for the best player in the world.

24-year-old Sterling, who has scored 37 Manchester City goals since the start of last season, has played his best football under current boss Pep Guardiola, since the Spaniard joined the club in the summer of 2016.

The 24-year-old has excelled under the guidance of Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola

Sterling took home the match ball, following his first ever hat-trick in the Champions League

‘What I love about him, he’s learning,' Ferdinand explained. 'Sometimes you’re blessed to be given a manager to learn from.

'I think Pep Guardiola coming at the time to coach this young players, who had immense potential, and the he’s got to have the attitude and the foresight to take it all in.’

‘If you look at the likes of Coutinho, Hazard, they don’t get the numbers the way this guy is. Every game. His power, strength, resilience in terms of tacking tackles and staying fit.
description: After the game, former United defender Ferdinand couldn't speak highly enough of Sterling's development under Pep Guardiola, insisting he is the best player in the Premier League now.
